Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I´ve ever visited.”
Reviews.Author: sugkukfittahora
Reviews.Content: I generally do not care about hotel standards. I am just happy if I get something close to what I pay for. The staff are very friendly at hotel Galeno. That is the only good thing about the [--] The radiator in the rooms didnt work. They did not call anybody to fix it for three entire days. The "breakfast" is a piece of bread and a machine-coffee that might actually be the worst coffee I´ve ever had. Ever. The room was exceptionally small and smelled of gutter. That was all OK. The real problem is that EVERY sound can be heard in the neighboring appartments. Every cough. Every whisper. Every sound. Stay at hotel Galeno and experience a few days of how it feels to live inside a nightmare.

Reviews.Title: “Make sure you get a receipt - and keep it!”
Reviews.Author: Yvonne C
Reviews.Content: I agree with most comments, small room, basic breakfast, inadequate bathroom - but the price was cheap for such a central location. Our complaint was that my partner paid on arrival by credit card. On leaving two days later he was asked to pay again! He phoned his bank who assured him the payment had been processed for the correct amount. The receptionist would not accept this and became very aggressive, saying we could not leave until we paid. He kept saying "show me your receipt" - which we had not been given. Things got very confrontational and it took nearly an hour before he accepted that we had indeed paid. Presumably this was because of a very poor Admin system.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go there!!!”
Reviews.Author: Stella_Hristova
Reviews.Content: I found a dark hair under my pillow, the sheets weren't changed!!! I couldn't believe my eyes! Yes, the price is really good but next time I would prefer a more expensive hotel just so I know it's clean.

Reviews.Title: “Not recomanded - hotel staff stole our money”
Reviews.Author: Adi M
Reviews.Content: For the money i paid, the hotel was reasonable, but the hote staff (probably the maid) stole 100 euro from the room, during breakfast. The real problem was not necessary the stolen money, but the staff and manager attitude. They said something like "We don't care, our personal don't steal, so call the police or this is it"... WTF !! And the second problem: they don't have free Wi-Fi to work in the entire hotel including the rooms. The Wi-Fi work only at the front desk so this is bad.. Breakfast is only a piece of brad whit butter and coffee.

Reviews.Title: “value priced...lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: shellyb72
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Galeno as part of a package trip we purchased for Italy. We were concerned about this hotel to say the least! All things considered I probably would not stay here again due to its distance from the metro station. (A good 10 minute walk.) After walking around Rome all day, the last thing you want is a 10 minute hike to your room. The room had NONE of the creature comforts you would expect in the US. No phone, no alarm clock, a tv that did not work (with no remote). The two rooms we had were literally right off the breakfast room, so forget about EVER sleeping in here. (Not that we wanted to.) The shower stalls are so tiny I could not even bend over to shave my legs! I looked up at the bathroom ceiling one morning to find mold ALL over it. ughh!! Everything else seemed clean. The rooms were tiny. Barely enough room to drop a suitcase or two. We would NEVER have stayed at this hotel if it were stateside, but When in Rome..... The Staff here was so kind. All spoke English, had a helpful tip to offer, teased my children and made us endless cappuccinos with a smile on their faces. For the price, we didn't expect much so we were not disappointed. I would be hesitant to stay here again though as it is a good distance from the metro and outside the tourist area.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ac5930
Reviews.Content: For the amount of money i paid, it was reasonable. In deed the shower was small and the breakfast crap. I could walk right outside and catch the bus to the terminal to transfer if i needed. there was a great pizza shop 3 blocks down. The front desk person was friendly and helpful when i needed to get to the tourists spots. If i needed to i would stay again. My sheets and towels were clean.

Reviews.Title: “Do not do it. Really.”
Reviews.Author: spems22
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel I have ever seen and it's totally not worth any of your good money. I've made a youtubevideo about the room (a.k.a closet) I stayed in, and the rest of the hotel, you can view it here: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hjP3Q-PKGfY The staff is rude, their English very poor indeed. The breakfast makes you cry, the beds are horrible, the bathroom comes straight out of your worst nightmare. And on top, the housekeeping starts yapping in quick Italian at 6.30 in the morning, every morning and wakes up the whole ground floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel location in Rome”
Reviews.Author: KJF345
Reviews.Content: Budget hotel close to Porte Pia in Rome. Easy to miss on the street, took two go arounds before our taxi found it! Definitely budget hotel, tiny room, security blinds kept the room dark, noisy in the morning as most of the rooms are close to the kitchen, noisy when people are opening or closing doors as the doors must be thin, but the hotel quietens down around 10pm. Bed was comfortable, we didn't need a view as we only slept in the room, desk staff at night seem to be primarily students but quite helpful. Travel from the hotel to the attractions was easy by bus or bus to metro. Breakfast simple but adequate. As we were on a package, I cannot comment on the room rate, but for simple accommodation, location made it a good place to stay on our first trip to Rome. Watch your wallets on crowded buses, caught one pickpocket with his hand in my pocket on a rush hour bus from the Colosseum.

Reviews.Title: “Find a good value somewhere else.”
Reviews.Author: cmk610
Reviews.Content: The staff was polite. That is the only nice thing I can say about this place. When they say their rooms are small they aren't kidding - way too small. My husband and I couldn't both stand in the room at the same time. The shower was a joke - completely unusable - missing a door and too small to even turn around in. The location was awful, too far from everything - we had to get taxis everywhere which added up - making this "value" not valuable enough. We suggest paying a little more for a better location.

Reviews.Title: “room was like a closet”
Reviews.Author: justagirlAtlanta_GA
Reviews.Content: This was the most cramped room I have ever stayed in and is really far away from Termini. The walls were paper thin and the breakfast was terrible. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Our worst place to stay in europe”
Reviews.Author: RandyTheGreat
Reviews.Content: Room on second floor, ex-smokers ( still had smoke stains on walls and curtains as well as the smell. ) very cramped for room and would not recommend at all. worst than a dorm room at a hostel. Had a fridge that didn't work as was well as a shower that leaked as previous reviews. Obviously nothing has changed at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cramped rooms that also need refreshment”
Reviews.Author: ys82Amsterdam
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in this hotel in Jan 2011. The rooms are incredibly small, at least the one I stayed in (ground floor). The walls are one meter away from the bed only. The shower stall doesn't close, therefore the bathroom becoms a swimming pool after 10 minutes. The ventilation is noisy and starts running as soon as the bathroom's light is on. Many rooms are next to the breakfast room and the din of hotel employees starts at 7.30am. The breakfast is very basic, two rusks, butter, jam and cereals, plus a hot drink and that's it. Useless TV because it has only italian channels, but TV is not important for a stay in Rome. The only good things are the price, the proximity to transports (Termini is 10 minutes by bus) and a relative kindness of employees.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay:thank you PAOLO”
Reviews.Author: Australia46
Reviews.Content: we stayed 2 nights and we had double room.The room was not so big but it's a standard size for European hotels.the cleaning service was exceptional, good position and many public transportation you desire next door.But the best plus was the front desk.Paolo helped us during our short stay on everything, any enquires, any map information....he was simply great!!!...always smailing and attitude for all guests and services.He is really good on this job and we would say to the property that you're so lucky to appointed him to manage this hotel.we travel a lot and we have been even to 4 and 5 stars hotel in Europe and we never saw a manager like him:extremely professional and perfect...Not even luxury hotel in Italy have a manager like him and we suggest the property that he will be a perfect 5 star hotel manager.....Thank's Paolo for made our stay unforgettable!!!we recommend this hotel to everyone!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - value for money”
Reviews.Author: Susan-Bugg
Reviews.Content: I was thorughly impressed with the service of the Galeno Hotel - admittedly one of the cheaper hotels and value for money - the rooms were clean and the hotel staff very friendly and welcoming - also speak English which was helpful as I don't speqk much italian. The receptionist Paolo was most welcoming. The hotel isn't too far from the main train station and just down the road from the Borromini chapel St Carlo of the Four Fountains - well worth a visit. The breakfast wasn't a buffet style but the portions served were adequate - served promptly and with a smile. I would stay at the Galeno again and would recommend this hotel particuraly to those on a budget - well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: xyjiang
Reviews.Content: The room is unbelievably small, the room I stay has a bathroom with width no more than 1 meter, terrible. They do not have hot enough water, wireless only works within a few meters near the front desk.. it's the most terrible hotel I've ever had in my life.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget Hotel in great location.”
Reviews.Author: minamatlaya
Reviews.Content: To be fair we knew it was a budget Hotel & I think people may have high expectations...Location is great once you know where you going, Porta Pia is close to bus stop or if you prefer to walk to Termini it is doable, once there easy to get to main attractions. Watch out in the metro, very very crowded & some nasty sleeze men may grab your bottom...Food delicious obviously everywhere you go...Not in shortages of eating places! Transport very cheap, tickets go from €1 to €4 (24hr ticket) which you can use on the metro/bus/tramway. Very long queues usually to get into attractions so plan your day in advance. The Hotel Manager Paolo was very helpful in terms of directions & what to see...the room to be fair is very standard but again only a budget hotel so not a place for those who want to spend time in the Hotel...breakfast quite reasonable considering, I could never finish it. Do not go on the Blue tour bus as staff would advise you to (they must be on some sort of commission), it is €20 for 1 day instead of @18.50 on the red bus for 2 days but they did not told us before so we paid for the blue bus...a bit cheeky of them I have to say...if you go to central Rome you pay & catch a red bus pretty much anywhere or near Termini station. We enjoyed our stay overall & 4 to 5 days is more than enough to sightsee.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but could be better”
Reviews.Author: ma_2508
Reviews.Content: If you just want a place to sleep and take a shower, this hotel is a good option. Location is excellent, very close to Porta Pia, where all of the important bus lines pass, and to small and nice restaurants (we had dinner every night at La Montecarlo, just one block away). Rooms are very small, but clean, and the bed is comfortable. But the room gets a little cold at night, and our heater was not efficient. Bathroom is OK, very clean, but the box is very small! I don't know if a larger-sized person would fit it. Also, the water wasn't very hot. Breakfast is very simple, but tasty, and the staff was very friendly. For a short stay, I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “OK for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: nbatishcheva
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 2 nights. Wouldn't recommend this place for a longer visit. However, if one needs just a place to sleep and take a shower between walks across Rome - that is a good option. However, the price for the hotel looks elevated for what it is (80 euros/night, but probably still a high season) No minibar, no interphone, no internet - for a longer stay that could be an issue. Pros: - friendly staff - location is fairly good, Piazza Pia is a few minutes walk away and it is a hub of multiple bus lines Contros: - walls are really thin and hence you hear everything your neighbors talk about... At worst, in the middle of a night given the level of noise you can find yourself under impression that somebody is practically entering your room while you are not aware of it - bathroom is super tiny

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money if you are on tight budget”
Reviews.Author: OlenaKalinina
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a double room. It was a promotion so we payed 2 nights for 3. For this money it was a good option. The room was small but clean and with private shower/toilet. The windows were very small and overlooking the walls inside the house therefore it was always dark in the room unless you switch on the light. They provide towels, soap and shampoo. The linen was clean. Towels and linen were changed every day. There were 2 small shelves near the bed. "Individually regulated air conditioning" mentioned in our booking was represented by a fan. There was a TV in the room. Breakfast included 1 cruassant, 1jam, 1 piece of bread, 1 piece of cheese, coffee/tea, milk, juice and simple cereals. Generally, we are satisfied. It is good value for money. There is public transport close to the hotel. If you don't mind walking it is also possible to get to the very center of Rome by foot in 30-50 minutes. The hotel is 25 min. walk from the center train station.

Reviews.Title: “It was a nightmare staying here for even an hour!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Skynet2010
Reviews.Content: It was the worst experience we had and we just checked in and within a single evening shifted to another hotel Des artistes' which was heaven compared to the hell we landed up first! Galeno staff are liars,they lie on their website by saying that they have air conditioning but when we checked in we were handed a broken fan when we asked for one, let alone A/C! the man at the reception was a guy from Egypt who gave us an indifferent reply, ''Why are you complaining to me, I am not the owner!'' Just imagine the standard of their service! But we were lucky to get another hotel within 2 hours,was glad to leave the awful Galeno! we didn't even feel like asking for the money back as the whole affair was so disgusting!Please read this review carefully and do not believe in those reviewers who exaggerate facts and hide the reality!If you are looking for the basic comfort dont opt for Galeno!If you do a thorough checking you will find you can get much better hotels at the same price.Hotels like Galeno are cheaters,they make profit out of our money without providing the services they should,so its not budget hotel either, they are charging you quite a considerable sum! were so disgusting

Reviews.Title: “Couldnot have shower for 2 days in tiny bathroom”
Reviews.Author: bhavnag
Reviews.Content: Bathroom shower was 2 inches opposite the sink. No screen or cubicle. Whole bathroom, sink, toilet would get wet and water leak outside into room. Room small. Changed room on 3rd day. Breakfast crosant, yoghurt, tea, cereal, juice. Near Porta Pia good eatery, choose from display cupboard, v. reasonable. Made us take taxi to airport and gave no refunds.

Reviews.Title: “worst place ever”
Reviews.Author: deandmel
Reviews.Content: This is the worst place i have ever stayed in. The room is tiny if your bigger than a size 12 you won't fit in the shower,when your sat on toilet your practially under the sink. The bed is harder than a rock, very uncomfortable. No english channels on t,v no tea or coffee facilities available.Breakfast is a joke, 1 hard roll 2 crackers triangle cream cheese and a luke warm overly strong coffee. I would recommend taking the city sightseeing hop on/off bus to see all sights [red bus] this one is 18 euros for a 2 day pass where the other hop on/off tour buses wanted 19 euros each for 1 day. these are a great way of getting around to see every thing. The red bus also has 2 routes red and blue. You can get on them at any of the red bus stops on either route. If staying near termini you can get on there, For a delicious dessert go to the road house grille inside the termini sna try their messy dessert absolutely delicious, Rome has plenty to offer just be careful where you choose to stay. This hotel doesn't deserve to have a star rating should be more like minus 2.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TakeMeAway44
Reviews.Content: Located a block from the Portia Pia. Close to metro and bus. Excellent restaurants near by; they will also sell you wine by the bottle to sip at the hotel terrace. Front office staff helpful and friendly. Rooms very small; could hardly move in them. Hopefully you don't have much luggage. Nice fan but no air conditioning. Bathroom very small but workable. No elevator; have to take luggage up the stairs. Nice breakfast - they serve it on a tray but it is more than you can eat, and it's nice to pack some for a snack later. We didn't spend much time in the room anyway, so it is a great value for spending time in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth a repeat visit - I have”
Reviews.Author: Manstontraveller
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my first visit, Nov 2008, and returned April 2009. Rome is such an exciting city so all you need in an hotel is a comfortable bed in a clean room with en-suite. This is the Galeno. The staff are helpful and friendly. A filling continental breakfast is provided in a friendly dining area. I walk everywhere in Rome, without fail, but if required the hotel is close to main bus routes, underground and taxis are plentiful. I have stayed at Galeno twice and will do so again.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best”
Reviews.Author: jeepee
Reviews.Content: Although rated as a budget hotel ,standards were below par.Bedding was clean but on asking for extra pillows I had to ask again the following day as they had not been provided. Paper was peeling off the walls and the general condition was very run down. Breakfast was very dissapointing .There was no choice and what there was was served to you on a tray short on content and cutlery. Breakfast consisted of 1 bread roll,1 croisant, small crispbread with a small wedge of processed cheese,A yogurt and the coffee was awful. On asking for an extra bread roll I was made to feel like Oliver Twist asking for more. The dining room had guest rooms opening directly into it and the whole place had a very neglected run down feel to it. The desk staff were polite and helpful in their local information. The hotel is a ten minute walk from poliklinik metro station (only three stops up from the collosseum) and a five minute walk to Porta pia where a 26 bus takes you right to the Vatican. The Hotel is Ideally situated and if all you want is a cheap place to sleep and are not bothered about a decent breakfast then I would say It is OK.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, excellent value for money, great location, quiet”
Reviews.Author: paulina7_8
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on alpharooms.com it was on offer "pay 2 nites get the third one free" so we paid 98 euro in total for a double room for 3 nights which was really great value! The hotel is basic with very small rooms but clean and on excellent location, just few minutes walk to termini station and 20-30 mins walk to city centre. Even close to main road, the hotel was quiet at nite time. It had runing hot water all the time and heating on. The breakfast was basic but good, fresh and more than enough, staff was friendly and helpful. Hotel is small but easy to find. We booked car pick up from airport and back from hotel wich costed €80 for both and as we were 4 girls it worked perfectly for us as the train from airport to termini costs €11 one way.

Reviews.Title: “Small, Simple and Safe!”
Reviews.Author: viksohsix
Reviews.Content: We chose Hotel Galeno mainly because of it's price; a real bargain for a hotel in Rome which includes a breakfast, and quite a good one at that! The hotel is situated near the Embassies; quite far out of the centre and from the main attractions, however we did walk every day. It took between 30 and 45 minutes depending on which way we went! It was an easy walk from the train station though, upon arrival, but watch out for Romanies as they seem quite keen on pick pocketing! Our room was quite small; quite an interesting take on the word 'bedroom' as it was mostly a bed, but was clean and well-furnished! The ensuite facilities were simple, but also clean. Our room was a ground floor one, which wasn't very nice when you opened the curtains in the morning to see the cleaning trolley! The area seemed very safe and quiet which was a bonus. The breakfast was excellent, full continental; with croissants and a choice of coffee, tea or hot chocolate and other such goodies. Staff seemed helpful, but we didn't have much contact with them.

Reviews.Title: “Galeno - Roma”
Reviews.Author: CCrivera
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a two week vacation to Italy. Our first three days there we spent in Rome and stayed at the Hotel Galeno. A three star and on the cheaper end of hotel rooms in Rome but I would highly recommend it. Had no issues at all. The staff was very nice - most of them spoke English. Clean, safe - off one of the main streets in Rome. When you pull up you will see a sign - HOTEL GALENO - walk thru the gate down a cobble stone path - turn left and there it is. We would definately stay there again - with in walking distance to lots of restaurants and the Porta Pia.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Galeno: Complete Honest Review”
Reviews.Author: katjad
Reviews.Content: Before booking any hotel, I carefully read all reviews. Having travelled quite a lot, I tend to pick up the statements that are most consistent throughout the reviews to pinpoint the actual facts instead of personal opinions. This usually gives me a good idea of what to expect. having read all the reviews of Hotel Galeno, I felt it safe to book the room through Lasminute.com. Firstly, the rooms are cheap. I booked a double room for 5 days, including a weekend, and ended up paying £180, including breakfast. I thought this was quite cheap, and as such, didn't expect any great luxury in this 2 star hotel. We found the Hotel very easy to find. On the main road, there are signs pointing to Via De Villini, on which the Hotel is located, and we didn;t ecperience any troubles getting there either. It is a 15 minute walk away from the Termini station. Hacing seen the picture of the front gates and the path to the front door, we found it very easily. The front door you see from the gate is the entrace to the block of flats, but there were signs at that door pointing to your left (left side of the house) where the entrance to the hotel was. We were early, checking-in time is at 14.00, and we arrived at 11-ish, but the staff at the desk happily asked the cleaners to do the final clean up while we checked in. All the staff spoke great English as well. The room itself was not small, I'd call it cozy, or homey. It was clean, very clean in fact, the bed was comfortable, there was a telly wit the basic Italian channels (but who goes to Rome to watch telly in a hotel, really!) and shampoo samples, soap, two sets of clean towels and lots of spare toilet paper. It was obvious the room was old, but it was comfortable and big enough for two people. The toilet had a shower (which had a showercurtain which could be pulled in front of it, the space was not big but it was used well) a toilet, a basin, a sink and a mirror. Also, our towels and shapoo and soap got changed / refilled every day, our bed was made everyday and the rubbish taken out. The cleaning staff don't speak much English but you don't really get to see them, they are very discreet. We didn't have a hair dryer, but every time we asked for one from the staff, they happily provided one. The room did have green, fitted bars in the window, but these didn;t bother us. You could still open the windows and they were there for our protection, the window opened to a courtyard that was also used by the people who lived in the flats above. Having left our grear to our room, we asked for a place to eat. they recommended this great restaurant (where we ended up eating every day, the value for money is great [pizza = €7, pasta =€6 etc. and the service is awesome) and gave us a map to the city and also giving us some valuable adise on where to eat, what to go and see, and most importantly, what to avoid. Breakfast was good in my opinion. It's not a buffet, you sit at the table and the staff wiull bring you a tray of goods. You get to choose between coffee, tea or hot chockolate, and also you are provided with a white roll, yogort, a sweet croisant, juice and pre-packed melba toast. It kept us going until lunch time easily, and we like to eat! The toast itself proved to be a good snack to take with you if you decided not to eat it at the hotel. The location itself was very good too, it was off the main road and therefore quiet. It is located close enough to the central to either go by foot or to take the metro, which is also quite close. We weren't bothered by people in next rooms, either we had really quiet neighbours or the walls were not paper thin, but we also had a good nights sleep. There also is a small market close by and the previously mentioned great restaurant. In conclusion, I would say Hotel Galeno is a good value for money and a great place to stay. The staff speak English well, and those who do not (the cleaners, and some of the breakfast staff) speak enough to get understood. Always remember that in Italy English is not spoken as commonly as in some other countries. The location is brilliant for rest and for access to central. If you are looking for a luxury hotel with too much space and for some strange reason plan on spending a lot of time inside your hotel room while in Rome, you might want to look elsewhere. Otherwise, it is a great place. I will definitely go again. P.S A bit for Finnish people: Hotellissa on toissa aivan loistava suomalainen tytto, joka on painonsa arvoinen kullassa. Loistavat neuvot ja hyva tyyppi! iso kiitos avusta!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Galeno”
Reviews.Author: billc9829
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at the Galeno, staff were very courteous and polite, will be staying there again when we next visit Rome. Cafe Palledio, 2 minutes from the Galeno is also worth a visit, very friendly staff. Thanks to all who made our visit to Rome a very pleasant one.

Reviews.Title: “Great Bargain”
Reviews.Author: Wine_Lovers225
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for 5 days and had good service. Hotel is close to Termini station, you can take the 90 express bus and drops you off at Porta Pia. Hotel is 1 block from there. Also, the 36 bus drops you off at Porta Pia stop too. Bus costs 1 Euro, and buy the ticket from the magazine stand at the station or in front on the corner. Make sure you valid ticket once on board bus with the yellow machine. The room is very small, and the bathroom is even smaller. The shower is a challenge because its VERY small. However, they serve breakfast every morning and is close to bus stops. Also, there's a little market down the street to pick up goods at local prices. The service was good, room was clean. For our trip is was perfect, since Rome has so much to do, we hardly spent any time in the room. For the price, it's a place to be considered. We had no problems with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Caution on the Galeno”
Reviews.Author: Mont244
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Galeno with my daughter for three nights during the Thanksgiving holiday. Location is just ok...reasonably close to a metro - but quite removed from restaurants/shops. Quiet location (which was good). The room was small and 'dingy' - but clean. A lick of bright paint would improve what is a very small space. Our groundfloor room had bars on the window - so the concern was escape in the event of an emergency. Fortunately - no problems in this regard! Bed was comfortable and additional bedding was provided instantly by a very helpful and cheerful cadre of staff (probably the highlight - they even put up with our very rudimentary Italian efforts). The room had no luxuries (TV was free to air - no English channels), but my daughter's request for a hairdryer was, again, immediately met with a loaner. The breakfast was ok. Simple - but enough to sustain until an opportunity arose to hit the pastry shops of Rome! In summary - for the dollars paid - the Galeno is good value. While I understand the need for security - I'd have felt far more comfortable with a quick release on the barred windows. If in Rome again I would probably jump to other digs - but if your package (and dollars) steers you to the Galeno it's not as bad as some portray.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable for the price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Before everything else, the expectation of this hotel should be set as non-luxury, yet clean and friendly budget hotel. As a single traveler, I had a single bed room which is a size of a closet. It has enough room for a bed, a chair and small round table. The bathroom is also small, standup shower, toilet and a sink next to each other. Though facilities are basic, it was kept clean and good condition which are the primary concerns for most tourist in a foreign land. Hotel staff are very friendly and helpful. It is good for a place to crash during a very short stay(2 ~ 3 days).

Reviews.Title: “tower of terror”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: arrived at night and found the hotel entrance difficult to see. ended up waking a poor women from her slumbers in the residential part of the building. basic room. no a/c breakfast was std continental,danish,coffee,bread roll,juice and melba toast. hotel was noisy at breakfast time....but we were all up anyway to go touring. unlike other reports we found the staff friendly and helpfull,even when the booking agent had failed to place us on the hotel books ,paulo was friendly and efficient. so...........cheap not sumptious. a crash pad only.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable for price £40 pppn”
Reviews.Author: EASTVILLEGAS
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel-31 May - 1 June 06 it is a 35 minute walk from termini station and not that easy to find. It is close to the government buildings eg British Embassy near Porta Pia. Off a busy main road in a quiet street. There is an electronic security gate entry press bell on pillar walk through a long courtyard where there are other private appts. Hotel is old & needs refurb. desk staff are fine all speak english. Rooms are tiny but reasonale price for central Rome we paid £40 per person per night. Booking said fridge in room which there was not. We asked & told only 3 rooms had fridges. Breakfast room okay or more tables in garden which was quiet but not particularly attractive. Room cleaned each day & new towels. Contintental breakfast brought to you at your table - average. Tourist tips catch red open top bus from termini station 13 euros for all day until 8.30pm which stops at about a dozen major sites-hop off and return to bus and all sites are spread out. Complete round trip tour takes about 2 hours due to heavy traffic but a real bargain. Go to Vatigan City on Wednesday morning when Pope at 11am does his public audience but expect to queue for a long time to get in any major site. Also try the pizza place immediately opposite the Hotel it is fantastic value. BEWARE OF CROSSING ROADS -DRIVERS DO NOT LIKE PEDESTRIANS !

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I have ever been to”
Reviews.Author: chush
Reviews.Content: The worst hotel I ever seen. They don't clean the rooms though they claim that they do. THEY DON'T CLEAN THE ROOMS. You have to beg for a shampoo as they fail to give you one. A hair conditioner is not even mentioned. The breakfast is AWFUL. I could never believe that anywhere in Europe you could be offered such a breakfast. The rooms are tiny. I am not a big person but I still found it quite a challenge to fit into a shower cabin. However the front desk staff is polite.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel A Little Out of The Way”
Reviews.Author: cincycolonel21
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of March 2006. The staff was friendly and spoke English. The first night they messed up our room and we were given a VERY tiny room with an even smaller bathroom with a shower/toilet. However the next day they fixed it and gave us a suite with 3 beds!(there was only 2 of us) The hotel itself was clean and quiet. The breakfast however was nothing to get out of bed for:a packaged fruit thing, a tiny glass of OJ, and some bread. The girl running it was very nice though and tried to make us happy. Location wasn't too bad either, it's about 1 mile to the Spanish Steps, although we found it much easier on our legs to just walk to the Porta Pia (like two blocks down from the hotel) and take bus #62 into the heart of all the sites or all the way to the Vatican. The ticket machine has an English option and a 24hr ticket costs 4 Euro. At Piazza Barberini(a stop on the bus line) there was an internet cafe that let you use your minutes like a gift card, you just keep your number and use as many minutes as you want each time, instead of having to use it all at one time. Overall, the hotel was nice especially if you value peace and quiet, but you could probably find a hotel in the middle of all the action for around the same price.

Reviews.Title: “peaceful and friendly stay at thegaleno”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hi there! We (3 people) stayed there for a rome trip during three nights. the staff wsa very friendly and helpful to us. for the price (100 euro per night) i hink this was quite well done. i did not regret my stay there. we had a quite big room with two windows. if you now worry abuot the noice: you don't have to, the hotel lies at a secure and calm street, near the opera. just ask the staff f a room in the third floor, close the windows during the night (you will have air conditioning) and you will sleep well. breakfast was quite okay, there was coffee and juice, diffrent types of bread, eggs, cheese, milk and tea. and if asked, the staff got us some lemon for the tea, so we enjoyed the meal. it was a quite good start into the day! by the way, the hotel lies in the middle oftwo metro stations, th "termini" and the "piazza della repubblica", go to termini, from where its a five minute walk into the hotel. there are plenty of buses in rome, but actually i do not know till now, wich line went where to... :-) i really would recommend the galeno, it's freshly renovated! so don't worry the pictures, i'm sorry that i did not make some to offer you... but believe my words. have a nice day.

Reviews.Title: “Galeno - great for the price!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked a trip through Go-Today and weren't sure what to expect when we signed up for the "economy package". To our pleasant surprise, the Galeno Hotel was nice... not very big, but clean and the maids came each morning. We didn't have a phone in our room, but the man at the front desk helped us several times by calling our bus tour company for us. The location is nice... we enjoyed being away from the heavy tourist areas, yet still being close enough to walk to either the bus or the metro. We walked a lot anyway, so the easy 10 minute walk to the bus (or 15 minute walk to the metro) didn't bother us. The walls were thin, but we were usually so tired at night that it didn't matter. We were only in the room for about 8 hours at a time, and for budget travel, I think it was a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel of Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: They ---- me with the price, the room was a dark little hole. Close to this location I could find for the same price a lot better hotels. And the service was horrible. They did'nt wanted to change the towels or the bed sheets.

Reviews.Title: “closet small, steam room hot, service better at the DMV”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel Galeno in the heat of the summer. The room was so small there were only places to pivot. There was no air conditioning and we were on the bottom floor where the hotel staff would walk by our open window and talk and work loudly at 5am. The people who worked at the desk were rude and totally unhelpful--(like explaining how to get in and out of the gate, or where the "breakfast" was served etc) The breakfast consited of things that come out of vending machines. Hotel Galeno was the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. I have been in better hotels for $12 a night in Mexico. Do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “like an east german gulag, without the friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: tonytronic
Reviews.Content: This hotel and its staff is absolutely horrible! Do not stay here. The rooms are tiny, loud and barren. There is no a/c during the 100 degree sumer months and every toilet flush rattles through the entire building. The staff is rude and unhelpful. I would rather stay in an Italian jail than to ever stay at this dump again! if you stay here, you will regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Galeno was okay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Galeno in Rome for three nights. It is somewhat out of the way and we had to walk a bit to get to the nearest Metro line, however, it was not a horrible walk. The rooms are very small, but there is air conditioning and it was clean. The breakfasts were average, as long as you are not expecting too much. The front desk staff spoke good English and were helpful when we asked them questions and assisted us in getting transportation to the airport upon our departure. Hotel Galeno is definitely a budget hotel but it is not bad. It had the things we required, air conditioning, hot water, and a bed to sleep in. The biggest problem we had with it was its location as it wasn't near the things you go to see in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Galeno is a winner”
Reviews.Author: Orlando_FLMoose
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is easy to locate with ample signage. It is well located midst many restuarants, stores with the bus stop very close & the metro not far. The Termini and all the major attractions are easily reached. The help is extremely friendly, helpful,& charming. While the rooms are small [so is the price], they are quite clean & comfortable. The water is snazzling hot. Only the total absence of soundproofing makes the Galeno short of perfect for its price range. Your rest is reliant on the loudness & consideration of your fellow guests. I recommend a "white noise" machine to mute this out. I fully intend to return to the Galeno, albeit with a "white noise" machine.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't go back”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at the end of november, and it was not very crowded. The rooms are small. There was mold all in the shower. Our room was right next to the breakfast room, which ment we were awakened everyday at 7am by the maids geting things together. The worst was that after 3 days neither our soaps nor our toilet paper was refilled. This only stopped after we asked the front desk for more toilet paper and we left a tip for the maid (I think it was the tip that did it). It is quite far from the main tourist areas but the train station is pretty close (not termini), and walking around for us is fine. I always felt safe walking around here.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely a budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Steve&Chrissy
Reviews.Content: The first problem we encountered with this hotel was finding the entrance. What looks like the main entrance to the building is not actually the entrance to the hotel, but to the private parts of the building. The hotel occupies the left-hand side of the building and the entrance is tucked away around the left-hand corner, and is completely out of sight. It wasn't clearly sign-posted and this made it confusing for a pair of disorientated and tired travellers. On the inside the hallways and stairs we small but looked neat and presentable and looked as if it had been redecorated fairly recently, except for the dining area, this has dark panelling which had clearly been there for years. Our upstairs room was small with just enough room for the double bed, if you needed to sit down it had to be on the bed. However it was sufficient for our needs as we did not intend to spend any time there during the day. The room also had an ensuite washroom which contained a shower, toilet, bidet and basin and looked quite modern, I was surprised by the quality of the fittings, they were quite good. Due to a problem with the extractor fan trying to work through closed vents, black mould was growing on the upper walls, and it was quite pronounced. The thin towels were changed regularly each day during our stay and opened packets of mini soaps were replaced with new ones. I did notice that that during the morning there was no hot water, so it was just as well we took our showers in the evening. There was also a television mounted high on the wall, but watching it was a bit of a guessing game as we don't speak Italian. The bed was remade each day but I did wonder how safe our belonging were if the maids let themselves in. We did not have anything stolen though. The staff on the reception desk did speak English, which was good, but with the exception of one young girl who was helpful and friendly, the other receptionists were rather indifferent in their attitude, not exactly rude but not friendly either. The breakfast was a very basic affair and comprised of one white roll, a pre-packed croissant and two small crisp toasts in wrapping with a small selection of jam and butter portions and a choice of tea or coffee. The coffee was very poor, I'm still wondering just what it was. The hotel is situated in a quiet area a little away from the bustle of the main tourist areas. This could be a plus if you value a good nights sleep. When we found our bearings we discovered the hotel was just over 1 mile away from the Termini railway and bus station. We got quite used to walking there, though it did entail crossing a busy road junction, to catch the tour buses. There is a Pizza restaurant right on the doorstep of this hotel which we unfortunately over-looked until our last day. Its on your left out of the main gates on the opposite side of the road and just before you reach the main road. It appears to be used more by the locals than the tourists. The pizzas are quite good and the staff friendly despite not speaking much English. Definitely worth a visit. Over-all we enjoyed our stay, but it is very much a budget hotel sufficient only as a place to sleep and get a wash. If you require anything more than this, the Galeno hotel is definitely not for you.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay, reasonable price, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in Feb as part of a package deal. Was a bit hard to find the first time, since it is off the beat and path but only a block away from the major streets and a few blocks walking distance from Piazza Fiume with cafes, gelato shops, grocery stores, great pizza, theaters, etc. Desk staff was friendly and houskeeping very nice (although had difficulty speaking English), served you continental breakfast of espresso, cappuccino, or latte, juice, hot roll and butter, croissant, and packaged melba toast. Not much, but they came back and offered us more each day if we wanted it. About a 10-min walk to the metro line B, 15 min to the Roma Termini, or you could walk up to the top of the street and catch the streetcar trolley. Private bathroom took getting used to, since the shower is located right in the center right over the toilet. Towels were flat linen, more like bed sheets, not terry cloth, but basic soap and a sample packet of shampoo was provided. Room was clean, decent, size was adequate, not big though, and the bed was full size taking up most of the room. Tiny TV on high shelf received limited channels, all Italian. Hotel occupies the first floor of a multi-story apartment building, so the gate is locked after dark at night, but you can press the buzzer, and they will buzz open the door for you. Never had to wait at all for this. I found it in a good location and well worth it for budget accomodations. Would recommend to tourists looking for budget, comfortable, but not deluxe accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “Think Twice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through a very affordable travel package -- so we expected a bare bones hotel off the beaten path. But we didn't expect some of the little problems that would make this hotel simply an uncomfortable place to stay. I did enjoy the neighborhood. It was quiet and away from the frenetic, major streets of Rome. The breakfast was fine. But I would not stay here again unless it was absolutely the best deal I could get in the city. The staff was not particularly welcoming or rude -- but didn't really provide much help. When my boyfriend asked for an extra towel, he was told simply "no." They made us feel like we were imposing on them. The room was small -- and we expected that. But the walls were flithy and one wall even had mildew or mold growing on it. My allergies went wild. The shower was also covered in mildew, and because it was so small, it was hard to shower without touching it. I didn't like that at all. But the bedspread and drapes matched -- although the drapes were torn. It was a little depressing to wake up there and try to relax there. But we were only in the room a total of about two waking hours each day. So, if you are just looking for a cheap place to crash -- Galeno is fine. Just double check to make sure you can't get a little better place for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “When in Rome........”
Reviews.Author: Meandering2
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful chance to see Rome this past year and the cost was quite reasonable. We knew that Rome could be an expensive city to stay in, especially within the older parts of the wall. So we had an idea that this inexpensive hotel would not be the ritz! In spite that it was inexpensive, it was a wonderful European experience! The Hotel Galeno is off a busy street and is in a fairly quiet working class neighborhood. We were within four blocks of the old city wall, in the northern part of Rome. There are several cafes and good Chinese restaurant close by. (Hey, their menu was also in English!) There is also a farmers market and a couple of grocery stores within a three block walk, so it was able to meet our needs of fresh fruits, soft drinks, bottled water, and other important "away-from-home" items. Our room was small but cozy. There wasn't much room between the bed and the wall. Storage was sufficient and the room had a refrig. The bathroom was modern, though I would have preferred a tub/shower combination. The towels were linen, which is more european. We would have preferred terry cloth, but hey, we're in Rome! I sense this is a cultural thing. (PS, If it matters, bring your own terry cloth towels!) The staff was quite friendly. We enjoyed people watching and trying to understand what was happening, since we didn't know Italian. The household staff provided a prompt continental breakfast in the morning, which was quite sufficient, though lacking in fruit. Several times we watched as the fresh bread arrived in the morning, since we started our days early as tourists. The latte was quite good and after several cups we were ready to see Rome. The hot chocolate was quite good, too. It took 3,000 years to build Rome, so it is impossible to see it in 7 days. I would love to return to Rome, spend more time in the Vatican and see more of the other sites. If I won the lottery, I would stay at the Ritz, though for location, cost, and comfort; I would return to the Hotel Galeno!

Reviews.Title: “Small but charming.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Galeno has comically small rooms. So small in fact, if you have even a mild case of claustrophobia, do not stay here. The layout of the room was well designed. There were plenty of high shelves to store luggage out of sight in our room and a long shelf above the bed to store everyday items. The bed was comfortable and surprisingly large given the proportion of the room. The continental breakfast was traditionally European. It consisisted of fresh hot bread (if you arrived early enough), packaged crossant and melba toast, along with fresh espresso and juice. It was quite good and the packaged items served well as snacks later in the day. The towels at the hotel are paper thin so American travelers used to thick terry cloth should bring their own. Also, bring your own toiletries because the hotel does not supply anything other than toilet paper. The desk staff was cordial enough (some more than others). The maids are very polite. However, the building the hotel occupies serves as an apartment complex as well and the residents are not very kind to tourists. Fellow hotel guests were very nice and enjoyed chatting about their trip so far. The neighborhood around the hotel is very quiet and the hotel is not close to the more tourist populated areas of Rome. If you are into people watching, this hotel is perfect. Cafe's and gelato shops are close by and have tables outdoors. However, the staff at stores and restaurants in this area do not know how to ease the language barrier. Know your Italian, or bring a great phrasebook. The Chinese restaurant three blocks from the hotel is surprisingly good and there are plenty of street vendors that can offer a deal. This area of Rome closes down early so if you want to enjoy the nightlife or a cybercafe, you better call a cab.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay here next time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked through a travel agency for myself & two grown children. It was clean enough, but claustrophobic. We were given a room on the first floor. It looked onto the patio which is walled in but we still felt vulnerable. There was no security screen on the window. The room was suffy, although clean. Our towels were not changed. I left my money clip in the room with maybe 10 or 20 euro in it (shame on me) which was gone when we returned and the window we had locked when we left was now open. The telephone was broke. Sometimes they would help us make a call from the desk, sometimes not. It did seem safe. We walked everywhere so bus lines were not an issue. But there was just something about it -- perhaps we felt no one really cared if we stayed as guests or not. I will look elsewhere for a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked a trip for myself and a companion on go-today and was given Hotel Galeno in my package. We traveled during late November when there would be less tourist. There was no hot water the first day and no explaination as to why. Some of the desk people were very nice but a majority were rude. We were told that breakfast was served until 9 but we arrived at 8:45 and were treated quite rudely and told that they prefer if we come earlier. Although it was definitely not a problem since the breakfast was not worth it anyway (prepackaged soggy bread). Also the hotel was a bit off the beaten track but bearable because the train station was reasonably close. We had to constantly request fresh towels and have the heat turned on in the evenings. When we just ignored about the heat, I requested an additional blanket and was asked by the hotel desk clerk if I had a medical problem and maybe that was why I was cold (apparently he did not think its possibly because it is winter). After the first two days or so, we just dealt with it and thought of it as a misadventure of some sort. However, on our departure we specfically requested a wake up call and was not given one until the shuttle picked us up. We booked the shuttle service with the hotel and obviously there was some type of understanding between the two- tell the hotel patrons one price and then the shuttle shows up (and you have to get to the airport with no time to waist) and then the shuttle quotes a MUCH higher price. I would not stay here again.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Galeno
HotelInfo.Address: Via dei Villini 10, 00161 Rome, Italy
